item.title: Students face new cellphone restrictions in 17 states as school year begins
item.description: The movement has gained bipartisan support due to concerns about phones affecting mental health and learning.

item.title: Trump says he’ll keep extending TikTok shutdown deadline until there’s a buyer
item.description: The president is calling national security and privacy concerns related to TikTok and its Chinese parent company highly overrated.

item.title: Fire captain accused of fatally shooting partner, her young son
item.description: A fire captain is being held without bond after his partner and her young son were killed in a shooting at his home.

item.title: Farmer’s Market Sunday Forecast
item.description: Showers and storms expected to continue into Sunday

item.title: Mother donates part of her own liver to save 8-year-old daughter’s life
item.description: When an 8-year-old girl diagnosed with a rare and serious liver disease needed a transplant, her mother looked within and found the strength to donate.

item.title: Beach & Boating Forecast Sunday
item.description: Morning storms develop and continue for the afternoon

item.title: Man thought he won $96 playing lottery game, but he won much more than that
item.description: A man in Kentucky knew he was going home with a prize after playing a Kentucky Lottery draw game ticket, but he wasn’t aware of how big a jackpot he won.

item.title: Sunday Thunderstorms
item.description: Showers and storms will continue Sunday, starting along the coast before spreading inland

item.title: Sunday Thunderstorm Chances Stay High
item.description: howers and storms will continue Sunday

item.title: Bradenton Police warn of email scam involving city permit invoices
item.description: Officials say the scammers are impersonating City staff, claiming extra payments are required and demanding wire transfers for permit payments.

item.title: Tropical Storm Fernand Update - 5 AM Sunday
item.description: Fernand is a weak "fish-storm" in the Atlantic
